meanings.definition: Resembling a nut in shape or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The acorn had a nutlike shape, making it easy to identify.
meanings.sent2: The walnut had a nutlike appearance with its hard shell and round shape.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a nutlike rock and tried to bury it for winter.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were a nutlike brown, deep and rich in color.
meanings.sent5: The nutlike seed was carefully planted in the garden to grow into a tree.

meanings.definition: Having qualities or characteristics similar to a nut.
meanings.sent1: The almond had a nutlike taste, crunchy and flavorful.
meanings.sent2: The hazelnut had a nutlike texture, smooth and creamy.
meanings.sent3: The nutlike behavior of the squirrel gathering food amused the children.
meanings.sent4: His nutlike determination to succeed drove him to work hard every day.
meanings.sent5: The nutlike scent of roasted chestnuts filled the air at the market.
